entry.title: Re: Logging Source IPs in SAP application logs when acces...
entry.content:
It is not possible for SAPRouter to forward the source IP to the backend, as SAProuter only handles incoming connections and forwards the connections to the next target at the network level.

In scenarios where SAPGui and RFC connections are connected via the SAProuter, the source hostname (terminal name) is actually sent to the backend by the SAPGui/RFC client as part of the SAPGui/RFC protocol, and the backend can use this hostname/terminal name for security audit purpose.
However, the source hostname (or terminal name) may not be resolvable to an IP in the backend, depending on the network setup

Kind regards,
Product Support

entry.title: Re: How to handle errors for semantic key with number ran...
entry.content:
First of all: find the German Version here: Late Numbering für Non-Key-Fields

What WOULD be the best solution?

Here the AI is right: a LATE DETERMINATION (i.e., a determination AFTER validation) would be the way to success – unfortunately, this does not exist (although something similar might come one day).

What IS the best solution?

Well, tastes are known to differ, so depending on the use case, there is no single perfect solution, but in my opinion, there are 3 approaches (each with pros and cons):

1. UNMANAGED SAVE
2. ADDITIONAL SAVE (without EML)
3. ADDITIONAL SAVE (with EML)

What does this mean respectively? Let’s start with the explanation at bronze level and work our way up the ladder.

ADDITIONAL SAVE (with EML)

Here we would implement an ADDITIONAL SAVE, which runs in the late SAVE SEQUENCE – that is, after validation. However, at this point the entries are not yet persisted. So you would have to wait until this has happened... here the BgPF framework or a V2 poster could be used (although I don’t know whether it can even call EML?!?!?).
In this method, the new number is then drawn, and the object is changed or a change is triggered via an action in which the number is drawn. All this with EML.

Advantage

- It looks very professional because you are using a broad bouquet of new techniques...

Disadvantages

- Depending on the object, it may have a final, no-longer-changeable status based on the programming logic.
- Via EML we would go through the entire validation phase again, which can impact performance.
- This can also lead to effects in all directions, like determinations being executed AGAIN or similar.

ADDITIONAL SAVE (without EML)

We do the same as above, but instead of an EML call, the table entry is modified directly.

Advantage

It looks "dumber," but is significantly more robust due to less ping-pong through the RAP phases.

Disadvantage

Here we leave the RAP phases such as locking and similar. For example, before the number is reset, a new draft could be created (if the user clicks quickly or the application directly creates a new draft), which does not yet know the new number and simply deletes it from the database during save.

UNMANAGED SAVE

Here we come to the "best" approach – the UNMANAGED SAVE. Even in a managed scenario, you can be equipped with an UNMANAGED SAVE, which basically invites you to call "legacy APIs." But you can also write the changes into the database yourself based on the passed parameters such as CREATE, UPDATE, and DELETE – to avoid going through all hell during mapping, MAPPING FROM ENTITY helps here. But before writing, you quickly pull the desired number from the number range and put it into the field before writing.

If anyone asks why not change the values in ADDITIONAL SAVE via EML: In the late save phase, changing EML is **NOT** allowed because it would, in a way, jump out of the poster while it is running, as it would open a new interaction phase again.

Advantage

Exactly as intended by SAP: If the framework doesn’t do what you want, you can manually intervene here and be creatively flexible.

Disadvantage

You do updates directly on the database? I thought we were past that era, but apparently, you still need this druid knowledge in some places. Okay – besides my inner monk, there is another potential problem: If the object is extended with new entities, you must also consider these in the save method. This might not be a big deal in development but could drive some developer in the distant future to the brink of madness. Now bets can be placed: How often will this "UNMANAGED SAVE" be replaced by a regular save via the framework, only to find weeks or months later in production that "oh, something is broken now." In such cases, leaving comments in the code is highly recommended – the next generation will thank you! 😄

Conclusion

As the AI already knows by now, there is still no LATE DETERMINATION, so you have to find other ways, and I hope I was able to provide one or two thought-provoking approaches.

entry.title: Re: Displaying Serial numbers in custom cds views Report
entry.content:
Good day @Jaavani_1016 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references, they provide more detailed guidance.

Serial Numbers, CDS View Material, Custom CDS Views, The all new Custom CDS Views app

In summary, serial numbers are exposed in public cloud, only through released interface views e.g., I_SerialNumber. You cannot join directly to backend tables (OBJK, SER01, EQUI) due to clean-core restrictions.

The approach to take when trying to display serial numbers in a Custom CDS View or Analytical Query is:

  • First option is to build a Custom CDS View in Fiori (key user extensibility) joining I_MaterialDocumentItem à I_MaterialDocumentItemSerialNumber.
  • Another option is to use Developer Extensibility to define a CDS with a left outer join between these same released I_ views.
  • If you only need analytics, another option is to use Custom Analytical Queries on top of your published Custom CDS View.

Below is a step-by-side step guide to achieve the goal

Search Custom CDS Views --> click Create --> Data Source Type = Released View

Choose relevant data and click create.

You will be taken to the Custom CDS View editor. In the Primary Data Source section: Click Select Data Source, a pop up will open -->  filter by Released Views Only.

Next, add an association.

Click Add Association --> select View --> choose I_MaterialDocumentItemSerialNumber. Join Using MaterialDocument and MaterialDocumentItem. Set Join = Left Outer Join. Then select your required fields. Save and click check --> then publish

After publishing, your new CDS view will be available for reporting in Custom Analytical Queries or expose as an OData service through Custom Communication Scenario.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Logging Source IPs in SAP application logs when accessing SAP Applications thru SAP Routers
entry.content: That’s a great question — this is a common challenge when routing SAP GUI traffic through SAProuter. Unfortunately, SAProuter doesn’t natively forward the client’s original IP address to the application layer since it acts as a proxy and replaces it with its own. One workaround some teams use is enabling detailed SAProuter logs and correlating timestamps with the SAP Security Audit Log — not perfect, but useful for tracking sessions. Alternatively, setting up an intermediate reverse proxy or firewall that logs the true source IP before traffic hits SAProuter can help improve traceability. It would be great if SAP eventually added an option to preserve or forward the original client IP in future versions.

entry.title: hierarchy node selection (without subnodes and leafs)
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I have an input control widget in my SAC story with hierarchy (geog. structure). I am using the selected members of that widget in the script. I would like to read only selected top nodes. Unfortunately when I use API   InputControl_xxx.getInputControlDataSource().getActiveSelectedMembers(1000); I received list of all subnodes and leafs. Example: selection is on EMEA and it gives me not only EMEA, but list of all countries in EMEA. 

This creates a problem - e.g. if I want to populate selected top node (EMEA) into different hierarchy to select different list of leafs (special org. hierarchy), or just simple display text "EMEA" and not the 50 values of each countries in EMEA. 

I am able to extract the top node as the first value in the selection, but only if a single selection is done in the hierarchy. If multiple selections are done, topnodes are not in the first 2 positions of the selection. 

If I compare it to Analysis for Office, it is working exactly as I want to have (selection is done on the node). SAC works unfortunately differently.

Do you have any suggestion?

Thanks

Jakub

entry.title: Join the Community Talks at SAP TechEd Berlin 2025 in the Community Theatre!
entry.content:
SAP TechEd Berlin 2025 is just around the corner — and this year’s program is packed with opportunities to learn, connect, and grow alongside fellow SAP community members.

Among the many highlights on the agenda, one area you won’t want to miss is the Community Theatre— a space where the SAP community itself takes the stage to share real experiences, creative ideas, and practical insights through Community Talks.

 

What Are SAP Community Talks?

Community Talks are short, 20-minute sessions designed for open knowledge sharing. Presented by community members, SAP experts, and partners, they bring real-world stories and lessons learned directly to the heart of SAP TechEd.

These talks complement the full TechEd experience — from keynotes and deep dives to hands-on workshops — by offering a more conversational, interactive format that celebrates collaboration and peer learning.

Each session offers something a little different: a success story, a trivia contest, a technical challenge overcome, a clever shortcut, or a spark of inspiration that others can build on.

Why You Should Attend

  • Learn from peers. Hear firsthand how others are using SAP technologies — from SAP BTP and SAP Build to AI and data analytics — to solve real-world problems.
  • Get inspired. Walk away with fresh ideas, lessons learned, and tangible takeaways you can apply immediately.
  • Connect with others. Meet passionate community members, developers, and advocates in an open, friendly space - in the SAP Community Clubhouse - where discussion is encouraged.

👉Read: 9 things you need to know about SAP Community at SAP TechEd in Berlin

The Community Talks Line-Up at SAP TechEd Berlin 2025

Here’s the full list of Community Talks happening in Berlin — each one a unique opportunity to learn from and engage with the SAP community.

(Tip: click below links to view session details and add them to your agenda!)

You can find the complete schedule and all session details directly in the catalog:
👉 SAP TechEd Berlin 2025 — Community Talks Catalog

Make the Most of It

Community Talks are all about interaction — so don’t be shy! Bring your questions, share your own experiences, and connect with speakers and fellow attendees afterward. These sessions often spark some of the most meaningful conversations of the entire event.

See You in Berlin!

The SAP community is what makes TechEd truly special — a place where expertise, creativity, and collaboration come together.

Join us at the Community Theatre at SAP TechEd Berlin to learn something new, share your story, and make the most of your community experience.

👉  Explore all Community Talks here

entry.title: 2H 2025 Release SAP SuccessFactors Work Zone: Transforming Productivity with Joule and Generative AI
entry.content:
The 2H 2025 release of SAP SuccessFactors Work Zone marks a major step forward in shaping the intelligent workspace—where productivity, personalization, and AI meet. With the power of Joule, SAP’s generative AI, this release connects people, processes, and insights like never before. The result: faster decision-making, simpler workflows, and an employee experience that feels seamless from day one through every stage of growth.

Joule Integration and Knowledge Bases: Intelligent, Contextual Assistance

With Joule, Work Zone becomes an intelligent workspace that adapts to each user’s role and needs. Joule acts as a secure, AI-powered copilot, helping employees and managers complete tasks such as leave requests, updates, and information searches—streamlining workflows and enabling faster, data-driven decisions.

The integration of Work Zone Knowledge Bases with Joule grounds AI responses in company-specific content, ensuring accuracy, relevance, and trust in every interaction.

Key benefits:

  • Personalized, role-aware support that reduces manual effort
  • Reliable, contextual guidance built on company knowledge
  • Trusted AI experiences that enhance confidence and compliance

Quick Actions with Generative AI

Employees can now access Continuous Performance Management Quick Actions within Work Zone to create activities, request feedback, and give feedback through a modern, intuitive interface. A built-in AI writing assistant enhances clarity, tone, and quality—helping users collaborate and complete tasks more effectively.

Key benefits:

  • Fast, intuitive access to feedback and activity management.
  • AI-assisted writing for clear, professional communication.
  • Improved feedback quality and collaboration efficiency.

Home Page Quick Actions

The latest release introduces new Home Page Quick Actions that bring everyday HR processes—like One‑Time Payments, marital status changes, or workflow delegation—directly onto the Work Zone dashboard. These enhancements eliminate clicks, reduce complexity, and deliver one consistent experience no matter the task.

Key benefits:

  • Immediate access to high‑frequency HR tasks
  • Unified experience across actions and workflows
  • Easier delegation to keep teams agile and responsive

Offboarding and Alumni Guided Experience

This feature provides a unified workspace where employees can complete offboarding tasks, access HR support, and transition smoothly to alumni status—all without leaving the flow of work. The guided experience streamlines task completion and ensures continued engagement through post-employment access to records, mentorship, and learning opportunities.

Key benefits:

  • Streamlined, step-by-step offboarding process.
  • Self-service access for alumni to key records and resources.
  • Continued engagement through events, learning, and mentorship.

Learning Manager UI Integration Cards

Managers now get instant visibility into team learning and compliance through new Learning Manager Integration Cards in Work Zone. These real‑time insights into assignments, completions, and readiness help teams stay aligned on growth and compliance goals.

Key benefits:

  • Up‑to‑date visibility into development progress
  • Quick access to data for faster, informed decisions
  • Stronger alignment between learning investments and business objectives

Building a Connected, AI‑Powered Experience

With 2H 2025, SAP SuccessFactors Work Zone continues its evolution from a workspace to a truly intelligent work ecosystem. By embedding generative AI, automation, and intuitive access throughout the employee experience, organizations empower their people to work smarter, collaborate seamlessly, and stay focused on what matters most.

entry.title: Re: New Employee Business Partner Data Model in SAP S/4HANA 2020 On-Premise
entry.content:
Hello,

general question regarding HR-Minimaster usage in SD and MM and new employee BP concept. 

The PA*-PERNR, which is used in partner functions employee in SD and MM master and transactional data is linked to the BP role employee (BUP003), vendor (e.g. travel expenses) and customer (e.g. employee) sales are linked to the role employment (BUP010) .

So this means,  that depending on the usage a employee has different IDs to be used, which are not linked with each other directly? This would be contrary to the "unique" BP concept, because it reflects duplicates on onbject levels or rather all objects have to be taken into account to get the full view / easy identification of correct ID to be used for a person.

Thank you for clarification.

Best regards

Marco

entry.title: Sybase ASE - issue in launching isql due to missing libsybct64.dll
entry.content:
Recently, I was tasked to install the product SAP Data Services running on Sybase ASE database on a Windows box. The sequence of this installation consists of several steps

  • Installing Sybase ASE database on the DB node
  • Create CMS and Audit database tenant
  • Create ODBC connections to the respective tenants from the application node
  • Install the Intelligent Platform Services followed by Data Services on the application node

During this aforementioned sequence of processes, after successfully installing the Sybase ASE database, I faced the below issue while trying to connect to isql prompt.

          

The Challenge: isql Connection Failure
I encountered a common problem when connecting to the isql prompt for administering the database and creating the CMS/Audit tenants:

The error seems to suggest a missing libsybct64.dll file. However, this is misleading—reinstallation won’t resolve the issue and may put you in an endless loop of installs and uninstalls.

Root Cause: Environment Not Set Properly
Upon deeper investigation (and reviewing SAP Sybase documentation), I discovered the root of the problem: the installer had not properly set up the environment. As per SAP guidelines, this must be done manually using a script provided by the installer.

This below shown script usually resolves the problem. In some cases, including mine, the issue persisted and isql remained inaccessible.

          

The Solution: Manual PATH Variable Setup

To fix this issue, we need to set the environment variable “PATH” manually. To find the corresponding entries pertaining to this environment, we should run this script at command prompt

Steps:

  • Log in to the command prompt
  • Switch to the filesystem/directory where the installation was performed
  • Find the script – in this example the path is E:\SAP
  • Run the script and note the output from the command prompt which will show the value needs to be set for the parameter.

          

          

  • Open system properties --> Go to Environment variables

          

  • In the System variables section, click on add new

          

  • Set the variable name PATH with the value obtained from the output

          

  • Save and close the system properties.
  • Trigger the isql.exe situated in the OCS-16_0 folder
  • Verify the successful connection

          

Key Takeaways

  • Don’t be misled by missing DLL errors—investigate environment configuration first
  • Always check SAP documentation and use provided scripts for setup
  • If the script doesn’t work, set the environment variables manually via System Properties

entry.title: Has anyone extended CALM?
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

 

Unfortunately, there isn't much information about extensions in CALM online. I have a few questions because a customer wants extensions.

6. Is there a way to display logs from CALM in the Cloud Logging Service? In particular, SLG1 from SAP.

 

It would be great if anyone has experience with this and could share it or point me in the direction of the relevant resources.

 

Best regards

entry.title: Re: How to handle errors for semantic key with number ran...
entry.content: It was definitely thought provoking 😁. In the scenario: ADDITIONAL SAVE (without EML), to solve the issue of losing the number, we could utilize the Shared Memory which is independent of the SAP LUW. We could place a central class there which gets the new number when we provide the UUID. This can be hooked in the SAVE_MODIFIED(additional save). At the same time the UUID-Number pair is cached in SHMA. When the new draft is created and sees, there is no number, askes for it. For the same UUID the cached number is returned. Using ADDITIONAL CLEANUP, or at some point later in time in mass using a timestamp, the UUID-Number pairs could be FREEd from SHMA. There is no SHMA access in the Cloud although 😄, and there is no working cl_numberrange_runtime=>number_check method on BTP  now 🤐 😁. There are still many walls we hit, smart pioneer developers risk they lives at customer side but finally solve it always as best they can 😊. This post is very useful and come from experience I hope no one misses this discussion and options before dealing with such. Otherwise many surprise can occur. Thanks for sharing all this useful information guys !

entry.title: Re: hierarchy node selection (without subnodes and leafs)
entry.content:
@Jakub19 

Unfortunately that's the current behavior of the API. When used with a hierarchical input control, the API returns all selected sub nodes and leaf members, not just the top-level nodes. You might have to use some workaround using shadow tables or may be maintain some attributes on all parent nodes and sub nodes to identify them.

Something like below. I know its an overkill 😞

// Get all selections from the input control
var selectedMembers = InputControl_Hierarchy.getInputControlDataSource().getActiveSelectedMembers();
var selectedMemberIDs = ArrayUtils.create(Type.string);

for (var i = 0; i < selectedMembers.length; i++) {
    selectedMemberIDs.push(selectedMembers[i].id);
}

// Apply the filter to the hidden table

Table_Hidden.getDataSource().setDimensionFilter("Your_Dimension", selectedMemberIDs);


// Get the result set from the hidden table
var resultSet = Table_Hidden.getDataSource().getResultSet();

var parentNodesOnly = ArrayUtils.create(Type.string); // To store parent nodes only
for (var i = 0; i < resultSet.length; i++) {
    var memberInfo = resultSet[i].getMember("Your_Dimension");
    // Get the parent of each selected member
    var parentId = memberInfo.hierarchies["Your_Hierarchy_ID"].parentId;

    // Check if this parent node is not already in your list
    if (parentId && parentNodesOnly.indexOf(parentId) === -1) {
        parentNodesOnly.push(parentId);
    }
}

Nikhil

entry.title: Re: Generate PDF form on S/4HANA Cloud, public edition fr...
entry.content:
Create a ODATA service ZDCP_GENERATE_PDF_SRV with the entity get_pdf.

data structure of the ODATA entity get_pdf should be with Parameters P_MForm(Edm.String), P_CForm(Edm.String) and P_docnr(Edm.String).  

Implement the following code in the generated class method ZCL_ZDCP_GENERATE_PDF_DPC_EXT->/IWBEP/IF_MGW_APPL_SRV_RUNTIME~GET_STREAM and

call the service https://abc***/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZDCP_GENERATE_PDF_SRV/get_pdfSet(IvMform='APOC_DEMO_FORM_MASTER_CA',IvCform='FDP_V2_DELIVERY_NOTE_V1',IvDocnr='0090000000')/$value/

data structure of the ODATA should be with Parameters P_MForm, P_CForm and P_docnr.

Check the OData Media Indicator for the entity type.

DATA lo_hlp TYPE REF TO if_apoc_or_h_factory_internal.

DATA lo_fp_srv TYPE REF TO if_apoc_somu_form_services.

lo_hlp = cl_apoc_or_h_factory_internal=>get_helper_factory( ).

TRY. " Get form provide services lo_fp_srv = lo_hlp->get_somu_form_services( ). TRY.

lo_fp_srv->get_document( EXPORTING

iv_master_form_name = P_MForm

iv_form_name = P_CForm

it_key = it_key

* it_filter_select_option = ls_appl-filter_options

it_master_key = it_master_keys

* iv_form_language = 'E'

iv_form_language = sy-langu

iv_form_country = 'CA'

is_render_options = render_options

iv_print_queue_name = lv_pq_name

iv_xml = lv_xml_in

iv_disable_cache = 'X'

IMPORTING

ev_content = ev_document_data

ev_pages = ev_pages

ev_stop_processing = lv_stop

et_message = lt_msg

ev_xml = lv_xml_out

ev_pdl_type = lv_pdl_type ).

INSERT LINES OF lt_msg INTO TABLE lt_msg_all.

CATCH cx_somu_error INTO DATA(error_somu).

DATA(text_somu) = error_somu->get_text( ).

wa_message-type = 'E'.

wa_message-text = text_somu.

APPEND wa_message TO et_message.

* MESSAGE i899(/cdbasis/msg) WITH text_somu. sy-subrc = 98.

ENDTRY.

CATCH cx_apoc_extern_services INTO DATA(error_apoc_services). DATA(text_apoc) = error_apoc_services->get_text( ).

wa_message-type = 'E'.

wa_message-text = text_apoc. APPEND

wa_message TO et_message.

* MESSAGE i899(/cdbasis/msg) WITH text_apoc.

ENDTRY.

Sample data for the parameter it_key

NAME VALUE

ReceiverPartnerNumber

SenderCountry CA

Language E

DeliveryNote P_docnr

Sample data for the it_master_key

NAME VALUE

Recipient

OutputRequestItem 000002

OutputControlApplicationObject P_docnr

WatermarkText Test Copy

LocaleCountry CA

LocaleLanguage E

SenderCountry CA

RecipientRole RE

PrintFormDerivationRule

OutputControlApplicationObjectType OUTBOUND_DELIVERY OutputDocumentType DELIVERY_NOTE

Replace the document number(0090000000), country code(CA) and the language(E) according to your requirement.

entry.title: Re: Syncing Hiring manager back with position in Onboarding
entry.content:
Hey @Gopinath_Murugaiyan ,

Fully agree this is the root cause and know it is. However our assumption was once the position maps over to ONB in the recruit-to-hire mapping, the EC rules and sync will align it back to position.

From a business perspective, its for the scenario that the HM of the position is too junior and does not have authority to hire. In this case, the hiring manager in RCM = the manager with the hiring authority of that position. This is the HM+

However, in ONB our client still wants the actual Hiring Manager (direct manager) of the position to sync up. Reason for this is because the Hiring manager would complete the welcome message AND the manager is defaulted as a key person to know. When the HM+ is mapped over, this creates confusion with the tokens and key people to know as the solution is calling the HM+ the direct manager of that new hire.

 

Is there any workaround or solution to get the position data to sync up at the time of ONB inititation?

We have also tried to unmap Manager from recruit to hire XML template but this causes ONB to fail as Manager is a required field for mapping

entry.title: How to retrieve planned order details after conversion to a production order?
entry.content:
Hi experts,

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, after converting a planned order into a production order, the planned order object seems to be deleted, and its information is no longer visible.

I would like to confirm whether there is a way to retrieve the planned order conversion details, mainly to verify when the conversion took place and which user performed it.

Thanks and regards.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to retrieve planned order details after conversio...
entry.content:
This is the standard system behavior in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

When a planned order is converted into a production order, the system deletes the planned order and creates a new production order record. The original planned order data (such as creation date or user) is therefore no longer available in standard applications.

However, you can identify when and by whom the conversion was performed by checking the corresponding production order details:

Steps:

  1. Open the Change Production Order app.
  2. Search for the relevant production order created from the planned order.
  3. Go to the Administration tab.
  4. In the Creation section, you will find:
    - Created On - Date and time when the production order was created (which corresponds to the planned order conversion time).
    - Created By - The user who performed the conversion.

These fields provide the equivalent information about the planned order conversion.

entry.title: Re: SAP tables (SE16) for the transaction: S_P99_41000111
entry.content:
Table KEKO is the cost estimate header table, with basically 1 record per material, plant, costing date, costing version, and costing variant (through the valuation variant in the primary key).

Table KEPH has the various cost component raw amount fields numbered KST###.  There's 1 record per KEKO record, plus a split between local and group currency, and between total cost of the components (so potentially 4 records per KEKO record) and the columns are the costs of the components or components of the children (such that if your program takes the difference between those costs, you'll have the single-level costs of the manufactured material).

Table TCKH3 allows mapping the various KST### fields from KEPH-KST### into the cost component group numbers.

entry.title: Re: SAP TRM Migration to Public Cloud – Cash Flow Transac...
entry.content:
Good day @ktemma 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references, they provide more detailed guidance.

Treasury and Risk Management, Migrate Data Using Staging Tables, Treasury Workstation

To summarise, in public cloud, the Migration Cockpit supports only specific TRM master and transactional objects. However, Cash Flow Transaction/Facility objects are not yet released as standard migration objects in the S4H Cloud Migration Cockpit. They only exist in the on-prem and private cloud editions. They are excluded from the public cloud because of the

  • Dependence on custom valuation areas and cash flow structure tables.
  • Restrictions imposed by the clean-core and simplified TRM data models in public cloud.

Note that SAP’s current roadmap (see SAP Roadmap Explorer – Treasury 2025) shows plans to extend migration coverage to Cash Flow-based instruments in future public editions.

My experience is to proceed with standard TRM objects using the Migration Cockpit, whilst you handle Cash Flow Transactions either:

  • As a manual post-migration entry or
  • as reference data through CBOs or SAC/Datasphere.

LSMW is not supported in public cloud and therefore cannot be used.

Below is a clean-core migration step when you handle Cash Flow Transactions as a manual post-migration entry.

Go to Migrate Your Data app

On the screen, click create --> Migrate Data Using Staging Tables. Give the Project a name and click Create Project. The system will take you to the Migration Object Selection screen.

Choose your suitable TRM Option --> Review --> Create Project.

Next step is to handle Cash Flow Transactions. They are not one of the standard migration set, make sure you use one of the following compliant options:

Open Custom Business Objects app

Create a CBO called YY1_TRM_FacilityData.

Add fields: FacilityID, BusinessPartner, Currency, Amount, StartDate, EndDate, Status. Upload the historical facility data here. Use Custom Analytic Queries to report or reconcile with TRM positions.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: What's new in SAP Logistics Management
entry.content:
SAP Logistics Management is our new solution in Supply Chain Management that combines warehousing and transportation management to streamline your operations with network-centric collaboration. As mentioned in the previous What's New article, we are committed to delivering innovations continuously on a bi-weekly basis. 

In this blog post, you will learn about the new features in SAP Logistics Management that have been released this week. 

 

Business logging for goods receipt posting

With this feature, you can view and analyze logs related to the process of posting goods receipts to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. The logging functionality provides insights into the following aspects:

  • Determination of the logical system and BTP destination.
  • Technical parameters used for the posting process.
  • Material document number generated in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition upon successful posting.
  • Various reasons for unsuccessful postings, such as authorization failures or connection issues.

This complements the existing functionality, accessible via the App Monitor Business Logs.  

 

Cancelation of logistical demand

You may use this feature to cancel the processing of a logistical demand. The outcome of the cancellation depends on the current processing status: for logistical demands with errors,  since processing has not yet started, the document is removed from this application and deleted from SAP Logistics Management.

Cancellation of the logistical demand is supported via the app Monitor Logistical Demands: 

The result is displayed in the business log (App Monitor Business Log)

 

Reverse possibilities within manage pickup and deliveries

In this scenario, it is possible to reverse the process via the App Manage Pickups and Deliveries at different stages: check-in, loading completed, or check-out. When a reversal is performed, the system rolls the status back to an earlier stage. For instance, if the current status is check-out, it can be reverted to loading completed, or even further back.

Special case: In an LTL scenario without consolidation cut-off, the consignment is only created when status "Loading Completed" is reached. If the loading status is reversed, then the consignment is set to status cancelled.

The various reversal options are also available through the micro process flow in the list report: 

 

Enhancements for landing page on SAP Build WorkZone

In the course of continuously improving the user experience, we provide some enhancements to the landing page: 

  • enablement of side bar for navigation: new icons have been created in order to increase usability of the side bar navigation. To enable side bar, the menu option "Side" has to be selected in the Site Studio of SAP Build WorkZone.  Once enabled, this is applied to all users in this tenant. 
  • re-arrangement of  apps in spaces
  • changed appearance of warehouse task integration card: we changed the integration card "Confirmed Warehouse Tasks" on the landing page to a bar chart. 

          

 
Required action: update content package
In order to activate changes to the integration cards, perform the following steps to update the content package:
  1. Download the latest content package file from SAP Note 3605828.
  2. Open the Site Manager for SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition.
    To access the Site Manager, you need the LaunchpadAdmin role in the SAP BTP cockpit.
  3. Choose Channel Manager.
  4. Find the content package and choose the Update content action in the Actions column.
  5. Upload the downloaded content package file and choose Update.

 

Semi-automated maintenance of handling unit dimensions at packing work center

With this feature we enhanced the Packing Work Center to reduce manual data entry when working with shipping handling units.
  • Automatic dimension pre-fill: Dimensions are now automatically populated from the packaging material master data when creating a shipping handling unit. This eliminates repetitive manual entry for standard packaging materials like boxes, containers, and crates.
  • Automatic weight reset: The weight field is automatically reset whenever items are packed or unpacked from a handling unit, ensuring the user is prompted to verify the current weight and preventing outdated data.

     

 

Improved visibility of relevant process steps and new field in transportation request and consignment

If a process step is not relevant for a particular process, it is now displayed with reduced opacity in the apps Manage Transportation Requests and “Manage Consignments.  This allows the user to better identify the relevant process steps:

Furthermore, in both apps (Manage Transportation Requests and “Manage Consignments, )  a new field, the "Shipping Point", has been added. The new field can be found in the view settings: 

 

Display of Local time zone for locations with freight request for tendering and freight quotation in SAP Business Network for Logistics Freight Collaboration

So far, UTC was used per default as time zone. With this enhancement, the local time zone per location is displayed for the carriers in SAP Business Network for Logistics Freight Collaboration: 

 

Address details for business partner

As we are continuously fine-tuning our existing user interfaces, we introduced a popover to display the address details for the business partner in the app Display Business Partners: 

 

All these features have been deployed today and are available in the SAP Logistics Management tenants. We are happy to hear your feedback about the latest enhancements. 

 

Further Information

SAP Logistics Management Product Page

SAP Logistics Management Learning Session

entry.title: Re: What is SAP's vision on "assignment types" in LMS
entry.content:
Hi @emanuelvynck 

Thanks for the question, and for the thoughtful feedback.

When we designed ILX, our research identified the key details users need on assignment cards to complete work successfully. Because card space is limited and customer needs vary, we prioritized the most common, high-value elements that serve the broadest set of organizations.

Based on feedback like yours, we’re making two near-term improvements:

  • Quick View on cards: Clicking a card will open a lightweight panel with additional details such as assignment type, description, and thumbnail images.

  • Search on “View All” pages: A new search field will help users find assignments faster.

Both updates are on our short-term roadmap. We appreciate your input as it’s directly shaping our next iterations. Thank you!

Neha Dhawan.

entry.title: Employee replication with inactive cost center assignment
entry.content:
Currently we have implemented Org and Employee replication from SuccessFactors to S/4 Hana mini master.  We had a company restructure and during that restructure the finance department has locked all their old cost centers as of 01/01/1900.  Now when replication occurs on rehires the s/4 system errors out saying

Cost center 1000/50004309 blocked against direct postings on 02/14/2023

I asked for finance to utilize validity periods for their cost centers, for our company that is not currently an option. This occurs in both SFEC and S4 (cost centers are passed to SFEC from S4 with the inactivation date of 01/01/1900 when locked)

1- Is there a work around, BADI, anything I can do on the HR side to stop the errors and complete replication for positions and employees in S4?

2- Are there any options in SuccessFactors to be able to edit on retro entries in job portlet with inactive cost centers.

Thank you for any advice.

entry.title: Re: Variable Pay - Can Assigment Details section to have...
entry.content:
@Laura_Gyselbrec 

See #2 below from this post.

Release tip and tricks for Compensation experts that need to do a cutover from a preview environment to a production environment by November 14-15 when 2H 2025 gets rolled out to Production environments:

  1. Configuration Transport Center will not work for MDF objects transport due to release version differences, it will only for business rules. MDF will need to manually recreated.
  2. In order to successfully import a compensation or variable pay template xml to production you will need to first search in the exported template from the preview environment for [hideInProfile="false" hideInForm="false"] and replace with blanks (through xml editor) otherwise you will get error messages in provisioning (the error message might not be specific to this but this is the root cause).

Good luck!

entry.title: Re: Custom report based on Material Classification
entry.content:
Hello @Dinesh_158 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references, they provide more detailed guidance.

Manage Product Master Data, App Implementation: Custom Analytical Queries, App Extensibility: Run Statutory Reports

To summarise, there is no standard analytical report that displays classification characteristics directly from the Material Master Classification data in public cloud. However, you can develop a Custom Analytical Report using standard in-app extensibility tools without needing to impact transaction data (PO, GRN, etc).

The classification data in public cloud is in I_ProductClassBasicData and I_ProductCharacteristicValue CDS views, which can be consumed for reporting through the Custom CDS View and Custom Analytical Querry apps.

There is no requirement for classification fields to appear in transactional data such as PO or GRN to build the report. You only need to use the correct join between Product and Classification views.

The following steps provides Clean-Core compliant Approach.

Search Custom CDS Views

Create a new CDS View, e.g., YY1_ProductClassReport à Choose Primary Data Source = I_ProductBasicData

--> Add an Associated Data Source = I_ProductCharacteristicValue to bring in Classification details.

Join Product --> Classification Tables. Join on product= Product field. Expose the desired fields, Save and publish the view.

Search for Custom Analytical Queries

Create a new query based on your CDS View YY1_ProductClassReport. Select characteristics such as Material, Brand, Colour, and Category as dimensions. Add Material Group or Plant as filters if you need.

Preview the report and publish it as a Custom Fiori Appy using Custom Analytical Reporting or Custom Tiles. The report will now be visible to authorized busine roles.

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Error during creation of business partner from ARIBA...
entry.content:
Good day @Sudharmv 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references, they provide more detailed guidance.

Integrating SAP Ariba SLP with S/4HANA Public Cloud Using SAP Master Data Integration

Business Partner Integration, SAP Ariba Integration scenarios with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud system

In summary, the error your encounter occurs when the Business Partner Function setup expected by Ariba SLP integration is not aligned with the public cloud partner determination configuration. Unlike Private Cloud or On-prem systems, in the public cloud, table-based partner determination is not accessible or customisable. All partner logic is handled through configuration apps and business roles under SSCUI and communication arrangements. The error indicates that Ariba is trying to post a supplier record with a partner function that is not yet active or mapped correctly in your integration scenario.

The public cloud clean-core provides compliant resolution steps.

Go to Communication Arrangements

--> search for SAP_COM_0053

Check that the arrangement is active and the communication user has Business Partner Integration authorisations.

Next, open Manage Your Solution app. Go to Configure Your Solution à Application Area: Sourcing and Procurement. Open the configuration step: Define Partner Determination Procedure for Supplier. Ensure that Partner Function VN is included in the active Partner Determination Procedure used by your Supplier Account Group.

Verify Account Group and Partner Schema Assignment. Make sure your supplier account group and purchasing document type both references the correct partner schema containing VN

Ensure that Ariba’s Supplier role SUPL maps to S4H role FLVN00 or FLVN01. The partner function VN must exist in the mapping.

Re-trigger the supplier replication from Ariba after corrections and monitor the status in Application Interface Framework. If the message shows green, then replication was successful.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Is the billing document type for return orders related to physical goods movement 'G2'?
entry.content:

Could you please explain why this is set up this way?

Thank you.

entry.title: "Money" and "Date" format display according to "Locale" in Statements
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m looking for some clarification regarding how Money and Date formats are displayed in Compensation Statements.

Our template is configured as LocalCurrencyCentric, but for some currencies (for example, Hungary – Saudi Arabia), the locale-specific format doesn’t seem to appear correctly in the employee statement.

=> Does anyone know where to find the list of supported locales for Compensation Statements?

Additionally, in the Design Worksheet, our EffectiveDate field is defined as a DateTypeField using the formula below:

toDate(lookup('WTZ_effectivedate', cust_coun, 1), 'MM/dd/yyyy')

However, the displayed date format in the statement doesn’t seem to follow the employee’s locale.

=> Does anyone know which format is actually applied by the statement rendering engine?

Finally, is there any SAP table or mapping that links these elements?

  • Tool Language
  • Currency
  • Date Format
  • Money Format

Thanks in advance for your insights!

SAP SuccessFactors Compensation @xavierlegarrec

entry.title: Re: Transport the GL account with implementation status "...
entry.content:
Good day @charlene2 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at these references, they provide more detailed guidance.

Chart of Accounts in S/4 HANA Public Cloud (Cloud ERP), Chart of Accounts, SAP Note 3332309

Transportation Management for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2408

To summarise, in public cloud, G/L accounts with implementation status Do Not Use are part fo SAP delivered content. These accounts exist in configuration templates (e.g., Replace Account Symbols, Substitute Account Symbols, Valuation Keys, etc.) but are not active and therefore not transported to test or production systems. The reason is, it enforces the clean core principle and protects you from accidentally transporting SAP-delivered configuration objects tied to inactive or obsolete G/L master data.

However, public cloud provides a clean core compliant resolution options. Let us go through one of those:

Go to Manage G/L Account Master Data

Identify the account and not its Do not Use status (Demo Screnshot has Statu= in process)

Instead of modifying SAP content, create a copy of the G/L account: (45050990 used in screenshot for reference purpose)

Maintain the same account group field status variant. Go to Manage your solution à Finance à Configuration Activity. Define Account Symbol Substitution. Replace the obsolete account with your active copy. This ensures a clean, transportable configuration aligned with the public cloud restrictions.

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: How to Register Lot Items on Physical Inventory Count Sheets During Cycle Counting
entry.content:
Hi

 

When performing a cycle count using the Job Scheduling and Mass Processing - Physical Inventory App  only lot-managed items cannot be registered.

 

The following error occurs:

====================================================================

TG21 0000000003  with stock type 1 already exist(s)

Message no. M7702

Diagnosis

You have already included the specified stock in the physical inventory document.

System Response

The system can include a certain stock in a physical inventory document once only.

Procedure

Make sure your entries are correct.

If necessary, change the material number. the batch number or the stock type, or delete the superfluous item.

================================================================

I have never registered a physical inventory count slip for this item and this lot.

Yet I get a contradictory error. There's nothing I can do about it.

 

Is there a solution?
